thump.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to hit someone very hard with your hand closed
thump.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: If you don’t shut up, I’m going to thump you!
She thumped the table with her fist.
thump.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: His feet thumped loudly on the bare boards.
He thumped his cup down on the table.
thump.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to walk or run with your feet making a loud heavy sound as they touch the ground
thump.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Stella came thumping down the stairs.
thump.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: if your heart thumps, it beats very strongly and quickly because you are frightened or excited
thump.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: My heart was thumping inside my chest.
thump.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the dull sound that is made when something hits a surface
thump.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The box fell to the floor with a thump.
thump.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: an action in which you hit someone or something
thump.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: If he does that again, I’ll give him a good thump.
